name: replicapool
title: Replica Pool API
description: The Replica Pool API allows users to declaratively provision and manage groups of Google Compute Engine instances based on a common template.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

schemas.name: Replica
schemas.desc: An individual Replica within a Pool. Replicas are automatically created by the replica pool, using the template provided by the user. You cannot directly create replicas.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: [Output Only] The name of the Replica object.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] The self-link of the Replica.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: [Output Only] Last known status of the Replica.

schemas.name: ReplicaStatus
schemas.desc: The current status of a Replica.

fields.name: vmStartTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this Replica got to the RUNNING state, in RFC 3339 format. If the start time is unknown, UNKNOWN is returned.

fields.name: details
fields.desc: [Output Only] Human-readable details about the current state of the replica

fields.name: state
fields.desc: [Output Only] The state of the Replica.

fields.name: templateVersion
fields.desc: [Output Only] The template used to build the replica.

fields.name: vmLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] Link to the virtual machine that this Replica represents.

schemas.name: AccessConfig
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine network accessConfig. Identical to the accessConfig on corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: Name of this access configuration.

fields.name: natIp
fields.desc: An external IP address associated with this instance.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Type of this access configuration file. Currently only ONE_TO_ONE_NAT is supported.

schemas.name: DiskAttachment
schemas.desc: Specifies how to attach a disk to a Replica.

fields.name: deviceName
fields.desc: The device name of this disk.

fields.name: index
fields.desc: A zero-based index to assign to this disk, where 0 is reserved for the boot disk. If not specified, this is assigned by the server.

schemas.name: MetadataItem
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine metadata item, defined as a key:value pair. Identical to the metadata on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: key
fields.desc: A metadata key.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: A metadata value.

schemas.name: NetworkInterface
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine NetworkInterface resource. Identical to the NetworkInterface on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: network
fields.desc: Name the Network resource to which this interface applies.

fields.name: networkIp
fields.desc: An optional IPV4 internal network address to assign to the instance for this network interface.

fields.name: accessConfigs
fields.desc: An array of configurations for this interface. This specifies how this interface is configured to interact with other network services.

schemas.name: NewDiskInitializeParams
schemas.desc: Initialization parameters for creating a new disk.

fields.name: sourceImage
fields.desc:
The name or fully-qualified URL of a source image to use to create this disk. If you provide a name of the source image, Replica Pool will look for an image with that name in your project. If you are specifying an image provided by Compute Engine, you will need to provide the full URL with the correct project, such as:
http://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/debian-cloud/ global/images/debian-wheezy-7-vYYYYMMDD

fields.name: diskSizeGb
fields.desc: The size of the created disk in gigabytes.

fields.name: diskType
fields.desc: Name of the disk type resource describing which disk type to use to create the disk. For example 'pd-ssd' or 'pd-standard'. Default is 'pd-standard'

fields.name: abandonInstance
fields.desc: Whether the instance resource represented by this replica should be deleted or abandoned. If abandoned, the replica will be deleted but the virtual machine instance will remain. By default, this is set to false and the instance will be deleted along with the replica.

schemas.name: ServiceAccount
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine service account, identical to the Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: scopes
fields.desc: The list of OAuth2 scopes to obtain for the service account, for example: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control

fields.name: email
fields.desc: The service account email address, for example: 123845678986@project.gserviceaccount.com

schemas.name: Tag
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine Instance tag, identical to the tags on the corresponding Compute Engine Instance resource.

fields.name: fingerPrint
fields.desc: The fingerprint of the tag. Required for updating the list of tags.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Items contained in this tag.

schemas.name: VmParams
schemas.desc: Parameters for creating a Compute Engine Instance resource. Most fields are identical to the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: disksToCreate
fields.desc: A list of Disk resources to create and attach to each Replica in the Pool. Currently, you can only define one disk and it must be a root persistent disk. Note that Replica Pool will create a root persistent disk for each replica.

fields.name: networkInterfaces
fields.desc: A list of network interfaces for the instance. Currently only one interface is supported by Google Compute Engine, ONE_TO_ONE_NAT.

fields.name: serviceAccounts
fields.desc: A list of Service Accounts to enable for this instance.

fields.name: tags
fields.desc: A list of tags to apply to the Google Compute Engine instance to identify resources.

fields.name: metadata
fields.desc: The metadata key/value pairs assigned to this instance.

fields.name: baseInstanceName
fields.desc: Deprecated. Please use baseInstanceName instead.

fields.name: canIpForward
fields.desc: Enables IP Forwarding, which allows this instance to receive packets destined for a different IP address, and send packets with a different source IP. See IP Forwarding for more information.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional textual description of the instance.

fields.name: disksToAttach
fields.desc: A list of existing Persistent Disk resources to attach to each replica in the pool. Each disk will be attached in read-only mode to every replica.

fields.name: machineType
fields.desc: The machine type for this instance. The resource name (e.g. n1-standard-1).

schemas.name: EnvVariable
schemas.desc: An environment variable to set for an action.

fields.name: hidden
fields.desc: Deprecated, do not use.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the environment variable.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The value of the variable.

schemas.name: ExistingDisk
schemas.desc: A pre-existing persistent disk that will be attached to every Replica in the Pool in READ_ONLY mode.

fields.name: attachment
fields.desc: How the disk will be attached to the Replica.

fields.name: source
fields.desc: The name of the Persistent Disk resource. The Persistent Disk resource must be in the same zone as the Pool.

schemas.name: Label
schemas.desc: A label to apply to this replica pool.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The value of this label.

fields.name: key
fields.desc: The key for this label.

schemas.name: Metadata
schemas.desc: A Compute Engine metadata entry. Identical to the metadata on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fields.name: fingerPrint
fields.desc: The fingerprint of the metadata. Required for updating the metadata entries for this instance.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: A list of metadata items.

schemas.name: NewDisk
schemas.desc: A Persistent Disk resource that will be created and attached to each Replica in the Pool. Each Replica will have a unique persistent disk that is created and attached to that Replica in READ_WRITE mode.

fields.name: boot
fields.desc: If true, indicates that this is the root persistent disk.

fields.name: initializeParams
fields.desc: Create the new disk using these parameters. The name of the disk will be <instance_name>-<four_random_charactersgt;.

fields.name: attachment
fields.desc: How the disk will be attached to the Replica.

fields.name: autoDelete
fields.desc: If true, then this disk will be deleted when the instance is deleted. The default value is true.

fields.name: abandonInstances
fields.desc: If there are instances you would like to keep, you can specify them here. These instances won't be deleted, but the associated replica objects will be removed.

schemas.name: Template
schemas.desc: The template used for creating replicas in the pool.

fields.name: healthChecks
fields.desc: A list of HTTP Health Checks to configure for this replica pool and all virtual machines in this replica pool.

fields.name: version
fields.desc: A free-form string describing the version of this template. You can provide any versioning string you would like. For example, version1 or template-v1.

fields.name: vmParams
fields.desc: The virtual machine parameters to use for creating replicas. You can define settings such as the machine type and the image of replicas in this pool. This is required if replica type is SMART_VM.

fields.name: action
fields.desc: An action to run during initialization of your replicas. An action is run as shell commands which are executed one after the other in the same bash shell, so any state established by one command is inherited by later commands.

schemas.name: Action
schemas.desc: An action that gets executed during initialization of the replicas.

fields.name: timeoutMilliSeconds
fields.desc: If an action's commands on a particular replica do not finish in the specified timeoutMilliSeconds, the replica is considered to be in a FAILING state. No efforts are made to stop any processes that were spawned or created as the result of running the action's commands. The default is the max allowed value, 1 hour (i.e. 3600000 milliseconds).

fields.name: commands
fields.desc: A list of commands to run, one per line. If any command fails, the whole action is considered a failure and no further actions are run. This also marks the virtual machine or replica as a failure.

fields.name: envVariables
fields.desc: A list of environment variables to use for the commands in this action.

fields.name: timeoutSec
fields.desc: How long (in seconds) to wait before a timeout failure for this healthcheck. The default value is 5 seconds.

fields.name: checkIntervalSec
fields.desc: How often (in seconds) to make HTTP requests for this healthcheck. The default value is 5 seconds.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: The description for this health check.

fields.name: healthyThreshold
fields.desc: The number of consecutive health check requests that need to succeed before the replica is considered healthy again. The default value is 2.

fields.name: host
fields.desc: The value of the host header in the HTTP health check request. If left empty (default value), the localhost IP 127.0.0.1 will be used.

fields.name: path
fields.desc: The localhost request path to send this health check, in the format /path/to/use. For example, /healthcheck.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of this health check.

fields.name: port
fields.desc: The TCP port for the health check requests.

fields.name: unhealthyThreshold
fields.desc: The number of consecutive health check requests that need to fail in order to consider the replica unhealthy. The default value is 2.

fields.name: autoRestart
fields.desc: Whether replicas in this pool should be restarted if they experience a failure. The default value is true.

fields.name: numReplicas
fields.desc: Deprecated! Use initial_num_replicas instead.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] A self-link to the replica pool.

fields.name: baseInstanceName
fields.desc:
The base instance name to use for the replicas in this pool. This must match the regex [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?. If specified, the instances in this replica pool will be named in the format <base-instance-name>-<ID>. The <ID> postfix will be a four character alphanumeric identifier generated by the service.

If this is not specified by the user, a random base instance name is generated by the service.

fields.name: initialNumReplicas
fields.desc: The initial number of replicas this pool should have. You must provide a value greater than or equal to 0.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the replica pool. Must follow the regex [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? and be 1-28 characters long.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional description of the replica pool.

fields.name: healthChecks
fields.desc: Deprecated. Please use template[].healthChecks instead.

fields.name: labels
fields.desc: A list of labels to attach to this replica pool and all created virtual machines in this replica pool.

fields.name: resourceViews
fields.desc: The list of resource views that should be updated with all the replicas that are managed by this pool.

fields.name: targetPool
fields.desc: Deprecated, please use target_pools instead.

fields.name: currentNumReplicas
fields.desc: [Output Only] The current number of replicas in the pool.

fields.name: targetPools
fields.desc: A list of target pools to update with the replicas that are managed by this pool. If specified, the replicas in this replica pool will be added to the specified target pools for load balancing purposes. The replica pool must live in the same region as the specified target pools. These values must be the target pool resource names, and not fully qualified URLs.

fields.name: template
fields.desc: The template to use when creating replicas in this pool. This template is used during initial instance creation of the pool, when growing the pool in size, or when a replica restarts.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Deprecated! Do not set.

methods.name: resize
methods.desc: Resize a pool. This is an asynchronous operation, and multiple overlapping resize requests can be made. Replica Pools will use the information from the last resize request.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica pool for this request.

optionalQueryParams.name: numReplicas
optionalQueryParams.desc: The desired number of replicas to resize to. If this number is larger than the existing number of replicas, new replicas will be added. If the number is smaller, then existing replicas will be deleted.

methods.name: updatetemplate
methods.desc: Update the template used by the pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica pool for this request.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica pool for this request.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets information about a single replica pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica pool for this request.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone for this replica pool.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Set this to the nextPageToken value returned by a previous list request to obtain the next page of results from the previous list request.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a replica from the pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone where the replica lives.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The replica pool name for this request.

pathParams.name: replicaName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica for this request.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets information about a specific replica.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone where the replica lives.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The replica pool name for this request.

pathParams.name: replicaName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica for this request.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists all replicas in a pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone where the replica pool lives.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The replica pool name for this request.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Set this to the nextPageToken value returned by a previous list request to obtain the next page of results from the previous list request.

methods.name: restart
methods.desc: Restarts a replica in a pool.

pathParams.name: projectName
pathParams.desc: The project ID for this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The zone where the replica lives.

pathParams.name: poolName
pathParams.desc: The replica pool name for this request.

pathParams.name: replicaName
pathParams.desc: The name of the replica for this request.
